docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Feb. 12 Indonesia said today President Kennedy did not have the right to insist on free elections in Cuba and reminded the United States that Washington had friendly ties with governments that held no elections whatsoever.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Feb. 12 Indonesia said today President Kennedy did not have the right to insist on free elections in Cuba and reminded the United States that Washington had friendly ties with governments that held no elections whatsoever.
